website_summaries.verdict: For those tight on space, the GOgroove provides quality operation for the most discerning consumers in an ergonomic case.
pros: With this preamp's compact design, you'll be able to hook it up in even the most cramped spaces of your rack
The 1/4-inch TRS Output really helps to make sure that you are sending only the highest quality audio signal
cons: The higher frequencies can tend to dominate
There might not be enough bass if that is what you are shopping for

customer_reviews.title: Lacks midrange and bass
customer_reviews.text: Compact and attractive, with a clear sound that unfortunately lacks mid-range and bass. I also had a hard time trying to eradicate a buzz which was probably from inadequate grounding (but which was not an issue at all with the Art Pro Audio DJPRE II unit that I replaced it with, an altogether far superior phono preamp that costs only $20 more).
customer_reviews.author: Adam M. Dubin

customer_reviews.title: Compact but not complete
customer_reviews.text: This product works well except that the low frequencies are not properly equalized. There seem to be too much emphasis on the high frequencies and not enough on the low frequencies. This product produces great high frequency response but the low frequencies are lacking on output. Even after equalization high frequencies dominate.
customer_reviews.author: NSquare

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will do
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is supposed to do - hooked it up to my turntable in 30 seconds, and everything works fine. I suppose there might be reasons to buy a more expensive preamp, but this one seems to do the job perfectly well.
customer_reviews.author: DC Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: Overall great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to invest a lot as I have another amp with both MM/MC capability’s, but needed a pre for a second system without a phono input. This product fits the bill perfectly. No hum, no hiss, no line noise. My only issue is lack of a power switch, for that it gets minus one star. Overall great little gadget!
customer_reviews.author: OSMedic

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with my JVC turntable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit and received it rapidly. When I connected it to my JVC turntable and Sonny Tuner it did not work. My turntable does not have a ground wire or ground wire connection. I emailed 2nd Ave telling them the problem. The said to contact Gogroove which I did. I called them and talked with a lady who told me it would not work without a ground wire and that I would have to purchase a preamp that did not require a ground wire. This did not sound right to me. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: REWDOC

customer_reviews.title: This makes my old record player sound great through the CD input on my home theatre system
customer_reviews.text: This makes my old record player sound great through the CD input on my home theatre system. I wish it had a power button. It works exactly as advertised though. I bought an electronic remote controlled 120v ac switch to power both this preamp and my record player when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Sound Quality, and doesn't ground properly
customer_reviews.text: When I finally received this after a week and a half, I hooked it up, and there were two immediately apparent problems. There was a loud buzz from the fact that it is not grounded properly, and secondly the sound quality only pre-amps highs, and even those it does with great distortion. I set it up on my friends equipment just to make sure it wasn't a matter of some other down stream problem, and the results were the same. HORRIBLE SOUND!
customer_reviews.author: William E Barker

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new turntable and receiver from Best Buy, and when I got home and began to set it up I realized that it needed a phono preamp to work. I called Best Buy back and spoke to the same salesperson and he didn't even know what I was referring to, and they don't sell them Amazon to the rescue. It came quickly. There is some hissing through the speakers, but it could be anywhere along the line so not attributing it to the preamp until I switch out the wires. Could even be the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hickey

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up an old turntable to my stereo system. The music from the record/turntable was so low, I had to crank up the volume to just get a reasonable sound. I contacted the manufacturer of my receiver and they told me I needed a pre-amp. I Googled pre-amp, learned more about it. Then found this one - reasonably priced - on Amazon. There were many more models, but some in the hundreds of dollars. I am not a super audiophile, so I opted to try this pre-amp. Easily hooked it up and the volume is fine. So far, I am pleased with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Jeka

customer_reviews.title: Solid pre-amp; great value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pre-amp for the money. It does not ‘color’ the sound. See attached images for technical details and a peek at the internal components. Overall I’m very happy with this pre-amp. It sounds excellent and does exactly what you’d expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Perez

customer_reviews.title: No bass and subdued mids
customer_reviews.text: Hoped this would work based on other reviews, but there is no bass. Sending back to try another, more expensive one. UPDATE - Was really disappointed as I was beginning to think it was my turntable/stylus. However, I ordered a Stellar Labs preamp on Amazon here, for not much more $ and wow, what a difference in bass and mid range. Beautiful sound now, from my old school albums! Very happy! Note, I have nothing to gain by this review except to help another album geek like me. I have no relationship with any seller on eBay or anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: This Phono Preamp has no bass at all
customer_reviews.text: The GOgroove Mini has no bass at all. the parts of sounds that do have bass it clips bad and sounds terrible. This may work fine on a very cheap system but its not a worth while upgrade for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: sunglass guy

customer_reviews.title: No bass whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Terrible cuts all the bass and much of the middle. Sound like you throw your speaker into a metal bucket. I have built-in phono preamp in my Audio-Technica LP-120, it sounded muffled with too much bass, but I managed to equalize it into somehow decent sound. This device cuts so much it cannot be equalized properly. Terrible sounding thing overall. I doesn't expected much with this price, though. Just didn't expected it to be actually worse, than built-in. If you desperately need a preamp, you can buy it, I guess, but I recommend to try something else, maybe from higher price range. Two stars, since it's technically works and do what it supposed to do, just poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Drozdov Semyon

customer_reviews.title: Connected My Vintage Record Player To My Samsung Sound Bar
customer_reviews.text: I inherited my late father-in-laws record player and wanted to find a way to use it with the samsung soundbar we already had installed in our living room. This pre-amp works absolutely perfect for what I was trying to do. I was able to easily connect the record player to this pre-amp and then into my samsung sound bar using an aux cord. The sound quality is great and makes it so easy to use with the least bulky set up. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and sound from an inexpensive preamp from GOgroove
customer_reviews.text: I used a GOgroove Mini Phono Turntable Preamp to connect a Technics turntable. I used a Fosi Audio BT30A amp with Boston A26 speakers. Easy to set up and the quality is good. The sound quality was good, especially seeing the size of the preamp. For the cost, the quality is good. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: IPG20

customer_reviews.title: Where's the bass?
customer_reviews.text: pros: price cons: totally lacking bass. I have a new turntable with an upgraded cartridge and after awhile I wasn't understanding why it sounded worse than my cheaper turntable with the built-in preamp. After doing an A/B comparison - WOWZA. I had been using a cheap preamp with my newer more expensive gear. Shame on me. I spent a little more and now it sounds fantastic with all the bass I was missing (I went with the DJpreII)
customer_reviews.author: Damian J Healy

customer_reviews.title: Very thin sounding
customer_reviews.text: It technically works, in that it does amplify the signal from the turntable, but I’m not sure if mine isn’t applying the RIAA curve or if it is just naturally very thin sounding. There’s very little bass or mids, and too much treble. It needs to be heavily eq’d to bring the sound back to something resembling normal.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Distorted sound
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this pre-amp, but when I hooked it up the sound was very distorted and sounded horrible. The output on this unit is +11.5db or somewhere in that range and it is not adjustable. I sent it back to Amazon for refund.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brenke

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly connected to my TEAC turntable and Pioneer receiver. The Pioneer receiver that I've had for several years does not have a "phono" input so to use the "aux" input requires an amplifier. This product works perfectly. Great sound, no noise..."plug and play" easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: RobertM

customer_reviews.title: It works but ya get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ya get what you pay for. I didn't think preamps mattered that much, but glad it only cost me a few dollars to prove I was wrong. They matter. Yes, still a great preamp for the money. But the EQ is too rich in highs and really lacking mids and lows... Ya have to add bass and take out highs... Then every time ya change to CD DVD Radio or TV you have to readjust the EQ. Doesn't really add any noise or distortion, but this preamp definitely sold me on getting one 4 times as much in $$$ and that didn't even do it. Eventually spent the required $300+ to get a phonostage that had a decent RIAA curve
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johns

customer_reviews.title: Seller was Great, Product is NOT
customer_reviews.text: This phono preamp worked OK for about a month and then the low end started to diminish and the sound was really poor. The seller, 2nd Street Electronics was great, and stepped me through the replacement process. I have decided to buy a preamp with a better reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Toast

customer_reviews.title: Problems, Problems, and More Problems
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: It sounds like you’re trying to push the signal through overdriven mud to get it to the power amplifier. I don’t know if it’s something wrong with the specific unit that I received, but I doubt it. It was WAY TOO OVERDRIVEN, distorted so badly that even with the power amp volume at “1,” the music was STILL unrecognizable. I see all of the glowing reviews and five stars, and I don’t get it. It sounds absolutely horrific.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: GOgroove Pre-amp Usage
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to work with my Sherwood receiver using its aux inputs. Don't know why yet, but it worked fine with my Pioneer Surround Sound receiver's aux inputs. The reason I purchased your pre-amp is because normally using the Sherwood phono inputs there was a in-balanced of the sig output. The GOgroove pre-amp worked fine with a better power amp as is my Pioneer.
customer_reviews.author: Royg

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it.
customer_reviews.text: This item will make your best vinyl records sound like a bad AM radio. Zero bass or low mids.
customer_reviews.author: Scafeets

customer_reviews.title: Nice Turntable Pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could connect my old turntable to my mixer and make digital copies of some of my favorite songs. This preamp has plenty of gain. I realize this is a budget item, but either a simple gain or volume control would be a great addition. It is quiet. It works very well for it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: crwebb7

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pre amp to hook up to a relatively new receiver without a phone connection so I could hook up a turntable to it and give the set up to a dear friend. This thing is amazing! Easy set up and the receiver now can be used with a turntable and it sounds great! A great find!!
customer_reviews.author: RJT69

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to run an Up2Stream Mini into so that I can get a good signal into my receiver. I tried the mini into the phone jacks and it was terrible sounding (very muddy). But running the mini into this preamp and then into a CD or DVD input did the trick! Sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: U2pilot

customer_reviews.title: ... if it’s the preamp or what but it sounds like garbage. I got an old record player from ...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s the preamp or what but it sounds like garbage. I got an old record player from my in-laws and hooked it up to my newer tuner. Maybe it’s the tuner doing poorly but the sound has no real depth or quality. I was disappointed. The last record player I had was a very old phonograph that had a huge speaker. It sounded amazing. Maybe the new tech just makes it sound bad.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Dill

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to bring my old turntable back to life
customer_reviews.text: I've recently gotten interested in my old vinyl collection of albums but no longer have my stereo receiver, etc. since most music is digital and bluetooth devices. I found this to allow me to get a line level input to feed into my computer or powered speakers. Great results; just looking for that next piece now to get the turntable output to my Sonos One or my tv's Sound Bar via bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Get the pro instead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the GOgroove Mini Turntable Preamp to connect my turntable to my Sonos system. The preamp was unable to supply enough signal to have clear sound. Returned it to amazon and got the pro version. Now the pro version is awesome. The pro has adjustable gain which is what this one is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron Batteux

customer_reviews.title: OOOPS!!
customer_reviews.text: Pre-Amp was to drive a Pro-Ject Essential III Belt-Drive Turntable (also bought through Amazon as a Prime Customer), part of a SONOS 7-zone Audio Home System, including a Samsung 5-CD Player (which works). The Supplier is asked to replace it, as a Courtesy to me and AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Peter543

customer_reviews.title: Easy - 1/4" TRS Outputs continuously
customer_reviews.text: My old received died. I bought a new one but got poor sound volume when I connected my turntable to it. I researched an found I needed this preamp. It comes with a 1/4" headphone jack which I didn't think was necessary. But I've found it helpful to record my LP music to another recorder while I'm listening them on my system. Inserting a jack doesn't mute the sound through the speakers. However you can't adjust the volume. Really good value, easy.
customer_reviews.author: Slszmidt

customer_reviews.title: Everyone with a vinyl player needs this!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my vinyl player is older (1980 model) and the sound quality is not good. I found this online and thought I'd give it a try to hook up my player to my receiver and speakers for my TV. THIS IS AMAZING! So easy and works better then I expected. Don't forget to buy the additional RCA male to male cable (it does not come with any cables). AmazonBasics 2-Male to 2-Male RCA Audio Stereo Subwoofer Cable - 4 Feet $9.49
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price = cheap sound
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your amp has the ability to lower your treble and turn your bass up because this thing kills any bass coming through. This thing is exactly what you pay for. Cheap price, cheap sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: What I dislike is the fact that I cannot use it. The turntable, which I purchased from Amazon and made by Crosley, has no ground screw in which to attach. I would suggest to anyone hoping to enjoy music spend the necessary funds for a much better turntable that actually works. Crosely isn't worth the money. And a preamp might just be unecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Walker, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: As advertised - great price / nice packaging / great delivery - great value overall. I feel that this is in the sweet spot of available solutions for this need. Buy without reservation. Perhaps a mega-audiophile would want to spend more, but I find it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your money.
customer_reviews.text: It small, easy to connect and hide. For the money, the sound is very good. Anyone who needs a phono preamp and doesn't want to break the bank, this is a good solution. I'm pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Roald van Antwerpen

customer_reviews.title: Not amazing but serviceable
customer_reviews.text: It sounds decent. Not amazing but serviceable. It certainly gets your phono equipment up to line level at a good price. We use these at a college radio station and when the DJs play vinyl it sounds quite good on the air. In a more critical application it probably wouldn't be as satisfying. I like the TRS stereo output option, which leaves another pair of RCA output connectors available for other connections. Nice and compact, quiet, works well, easy to hide behind furniture and such. At this price there's no reason not to try one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Works great to get my turntable up to modern levels so my new amp can utilize it. Great customer service. The first pre-amp didn't work but I didn't know that until after I had modified the cord to put in an on-off switch. They were happy to accept it in that condition for exchange. The swap was fast and successful.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound, but lacks lower frequencies
customer_reviews.text: Sound is clear, however I had to really adjust the EQ of my receiver in order to hear any lower frequencies. Because I also use this receiver for TV and music streaming, I can't leave the EQ settings as bass heavy as required for this preamp. Returned and went with another brand (Steller Labs).
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Simple Solution!!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter purchased a $99 record player, came home and asked : "How do I make this work?". If you don't want to buy a analog receiver and an Equalizer, and if the Record Player you have does does not have bluetooth (like ours). GET THIS and a bluetooth speaker with volume control and a few equalizer music presets and your good to go! The other route we would have spent $160. We already had a nice bluetooth speaker so the GOgroove Mini Phono Turntable Preamp and a $6 cable was the perfect solution. Teenage daughter is happy......... this week. Dad too, $36 smile.
customer_reviews.author: Building a Costume

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as promised and in good condition. Plugged the little box into my turntable ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised and in good condition. Plugged the little box into my turntable and my new amp and it worked, with a little more volume boost. My older Technics amp had a built in preamp for phonographs. Too bad new ones don't.
customer_reviews.author: polAris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Works exactly as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: We received a tabletop record player from family, but quickly realized we needed a pre-amp in order to use it with our receiver. Our RCA cables from the player went in; another set of our RCA cables went to the receiver. Plugged in the pre-amp, turned the whole thing on, and it worked perfectly the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Wangenstein

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Works using the RCA input/output jacks. 1/4" output only had the right channel working, nothing on the left channel. Output volume is a little low compared to other inputs, but my mixer can compensate for it. There was a slight hum even though I had the ground wire from the phono connected to this unit. Hum went away when I connect the phono ground to another ground source. For the money it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have for Records
customer_reviews.text: Most stereos don't come with phono jacks anymore--and that means they don't have built-in preamps for turntables, so if you want to play your old records, you need a separate preamp. The GOgroove Mini Phono Turntable Preamp works well, so now I'm listening to all my old Grateful Dead albums!
customer_reviews.author: RJ Schimenz

customer_reviews.title: Supurb preamp
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It met my needs perfectly. Sound quality is very good. The lack of a power switch is not an issue. The ac adapter is overkill for this - rated 12v @ 500ma, as the amp draws under 10 ma. I would recommend it to anyone else who needs a phono amp.
customer_reviews.author: Hagggl

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Even Try It
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. Tried to pair with a brand new Audio Technica AT-LP120. I don’t know why it has so many good reviews. There’s a very noticeable 60Hz hum that bleeds into the output. Gain is very low and low-frequency response is nonexistent. It was so bad that I genuinely thought I got a defective unit. Not to mention there’s no gain control on the unit. Don’t waste your time with this one. I returned it and purchased the ART DJPREII instead.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Tellez

customer_reviews.title: Limited audio LF bandwidth?
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and easy setup, but audio frequency rolls off significantly below about 800 Hz. on my LAB 400, resulting in poor audio LF response. Using premium cartridge and cables, etc. Note that there is no specific bandwidth specification (other than RIAA) for this product, compared to other , similar preamps.
customer_reviews.author: Ham Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a new DJ's turntable (so it doesn't have a preamp built in like most turntables), ergo, needed a preamp! This one is great, it's mini so it fits perfectly in between my turntable and my speakers and the sound is spectacular. Didn't even need to buy a power amp. Saved so much money with this little guy. And the setup was super easy, just hooked up my two RCA cables in the turntable and out the speakers. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas B

customer_reviews.title: Static and very low bass response
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product with a Fluance RT82 turntable. I found that the unit puts out a significant amount of static and has very poor bass response. I am going to replace this item. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's record player that he did not want a big receiver or amp. It works perfect to play his albums and connects great to his speaker. sound is good and he is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this preamp
customer_reviews.text: Needed a preamp for my new receiver and old Technics turntable. I found out after buying a receiver that I needed a preamp for my turntable to work. Set up was easy (I had no idea what I was doing) I have only had it set up for one week but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Realized I needed this when I hooked up an older turntable to a small amp I'd purchased. Since the older turntable didn't have a preamp I purchased this. It's basically plug and play. I'm very satisfied with it. And the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Gives me exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I see many more expensive alternatives, but this preamp is a simple device that I'm using between my turntable and into my computer for digitizing stacks of old LP albums. I record to HiDef wav, and I get the sound quality I want without having to spend considerably more for other preamps. This, along with click suppression software (as an option with Total Recorder), gives me better than CD quality reproductions of all my decades old music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even know that this was needed...
customer_reviews.text: My receiver doesn't have a dedicated phono jack, and I couldn't figure out why the record player wouldn't play through it. This solved the problem without a new system.
customer_reviews.author: J Turner

customer_reviews.title: Purpose of use.
customer_reviews.text: Use before mixer so my mixer is volume control. Sounds great makes the vinyl sound real clean and crisp. Now my collection is about 90% pristine.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick l Range jr.

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete review
customer_reviews.text: the preamp seems to work and was easy to hook up. I can't really rate it because my turntable broke. Once I get it fixed and can actually hear music I'll update this.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy setup: turntable plugs into "Input" and stereo receiver "Line" plugs into "Output" using Left/Right RCA plugs. Turntable ground wire connects to Phono Pre Amp ground screw. Presto! Good sound, low hum.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy for the Money
customer_reviews.text: A great little preamp for my turntable. It seems to have a nice flat balance and doesn't color the music, It really seems to be flat over the range and very little distortion.
customer_reviews.author: ARES/Races/guy

customer_reviews.title: Great little phono pre amp
customer_reviews.text: Great phono pre amp for reasonable price. Got new receiver without phono input, so I needed pre amp for my Technics SL-BD22 turntable. Works great and sounds great
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick. The old school turntable I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick. The old school turntable I have wouldn't provide enough power into the more recent tuner I have. Now my records play much louder. Thanks, Terry
customer_reviews.author: Terry Mangum

customer_reviews.title: Just what I ordered and installation was very easy. Works great with my 1980 Philips 677 turntable ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I ordered and installation was very easy. Works great with my 1980 Philips 677 turntable and my new Pioneer receiver that did not have a “phono” input. This pre-amp provided the increased signal strength that my receiver amplifier needed. Great sound!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed to connect my circa 2000 turntable to a more recent AV receiver. The sound is good, without any noticeable distortion. No need for a grounding wire with this setup.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Worked using an old Duel turntable with a Onkyo receiver. I connected the outputs from the preamp to the CD inputs on the receiver and the sound was great with plenty of volume.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Price

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: You can't turn it off without unplugging it, no volume knob, crackly ins and outs, stereo is choppy and distorted. I tested all my other gear with other stuff and this is the culprit. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good money gadget
customer_reviews.text: Good gadget here. Helped my old turntable turn back the time and sound rockin. “And you can believe tat!” - Roman Reighns
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have to bridge the gap until You find a receiver or not it preforms as advertised
customer_reviews.author: MWG

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Yamaha turntable and a new Onkyo receiver. this worked perfectly and the sound is good. I am pleased with it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Just the solution!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Ran an old Sanyo turntable through it, no issues. The only feature I might add would be an on/off switch, this set-up runs through a powered speaker system and not a switched system so will stay on even when speakers are off, unless physically unplugged. Will probably run it through a power strip in order to turn the whole system off at once. Still 5 stars considering everything.
customer_reviews.author: G. J. Sebring

customer_reviews.title: Brought my 40 year old turntable back to life by ...
customer_reviews.text: Brought my 40 year old turntable back to life by letting me hook it up to my receiver. Seemed the power cable had to be oriented just right to make it work when I first plugged it in. Hasn't been an issue since, hence the reason I knocked 1 star off.
customer_reviews.author: ep001

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t really know what to expect. Was very pleased. Only have used it for a couple days but so far. Great. Quick shipping. Low price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Harris

customer_reviews.title: Probably would work better on a different turntable
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a bit and returned it, did not get the job done for my turn table
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Glad I took care of those vinyls
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised; allowing my very, very old Technica turntable to play thru a newer Receiver. I can now crank up those old J. Geils, Robert Palmer, Stones, et al vinyls. Glad I took care of those vinyls, kept them, and, kept them in their original packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: No volume control.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good for the price. Mine did not distort or have any background noise. The turntable and the pre-amp were grounded.
customer_reviews.author: Jan  Reed

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to not like about a Preamp to get your turntable running at this price. The RCA outputs work perfectly with my powered Fostex Monitors. I even bought a 1/4inch stereo cable to plug (using the TRS output on the preamp simultaneously) into a Powered sub-woofer to fill out the sound as the setup without it was lacking in the low end. My only complaint is that there is no power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money just buy a better one
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as expected. Purchased to work with my Technique 1200 and our new Sonos Speakers. I tried everything I could think of to improve the sound. The quality just doesn't come out. Don't waste your money just buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy hook up. A very little static. Hooked up to Bose lifestyle 12.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A Boettcher

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked for only mids and height. No bass whatsoever. Have to return. I ponied up and got the Pro Ject phono box instead and that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play!
customer_reviews.text: Unit is small and easily tucked away in the shelf. Sounds superb in my set-up. I am happpy with the device and the seller was highly responsive. I have recommended this piece of equipment to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent C Cox

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't review items which i know i should, but this works very well. I am using this for my turntable and it was low noise. Well, i hooked this up and im shocked not even a $400 audio mixer I got can record this good has. Definitely recommend. I hear no white noise or static noise i hooked this up from my turn table using rca to aux and theline in on my computer record using free program audacity and you should be set for great sounding music!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Super simple and does just what I need
customer_reviews.text: I bought an old turntable and to integrate it with a more modern amp This is just what you need to go to a line input.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great price - Works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Brain-dead simple to install - no need for instructions. Works like a charm. Listening to McClains "American Pie" with it 'cause SONY decided nobody plays LP's anymore so the stripped the pre-amp from their receiver. I guess that's why they eat squid ink.
customer_reviews.author: Boat Man

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great little pre-amp for the money. My wife and I dusted off our old phono just for laughs and as a conversion piece. This did the trick nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jetertorre

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to be able to use my turntable again. Easy to hook up and sounds very transparent. Simple easy to use device that does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M Carter

customer_reviews.title: Quiet PRE AMP.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality unit. NO noise when in use. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: COMPACT KIT
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Great sound quality. Listening to vinyl again.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHPIZ

customer_reviews.title: Great phono adapter
customer_reviews.text: This is a direct box for your phonograph. It does not have any way to adjust the volume as far as I've been able to determine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Make sure that the speakers are RCA connectable
customer_reviews.text: I like that its RCA comparable which is a plus , there isn't anything that I don't like about it , Im pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Latimer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son advised me to purchase this to increase my turntable volume on my surround sound.(in stereo mode) Works great. I'm now playing my 40 year old vynil records that sound really good!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for his birthday, and it was the perfect gift. My husband was having trouble with the sound of his turn table, we added this bad boy to the mix, and BAM! Great sound! Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Small, quiet, simple. Be sure to connect the ground to your turntable ground to prevent 60 cycle hum.
customer_reviews.author: Packer Fan

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable hum
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up to an old turntable and the hum was noticeable. I figured the turntable electronics had gone bad, so I purchased a new turntable. I had the option to us the internal or external amp and when I tried the external amp, the hum was back. Maybe I got a bad one?
customer_reviews.author: T C Lee

customer_reviews.title: perfection
customer_reviews.text: at first i was getting so much buzz, but it turned out one of my rca cables were trash... bought a 1 1/2 ft replacement on here for $4, now there's ZERO buzz...so clear... love it.
customer_reviews.author: Delphrano

customer_reviews.title: This is the amp. To buy that will bring your records back to lifeou your records
customer_reviews.text: Great product I like the size .. Works great with my new receiver ... It has brought my records back to life,and I couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: I can hear my record player now
customer_reviews.text: This thing amps the signal from your record player to your stereo. There are no controls, it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't work
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my Kenwood turntable and my Denon receiver and I can't get it to work, at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Stover

customer_reviews.title: It worked and was easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used it to hook up my turntable to my receiver. It was easy to install and now I can listen to my old vinyl collection. The sound is OK, not great, but I don't know if that's the fault of the preamp. Never bought one before and only spent $30 on this one so it does a pretty good job at a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: CBB306

customer_reviews.title: works with myturntable
customer_reviews.text: Now I can listen to my records on my receiver at an affordable price
customer_reviews.author: Beyous

customer_reviews.title: Does Exactly What It's Supposed to Do
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. No additional noise or anything. Sounds clear and fine to me. The ground screw doesn't hold my ground wire so well sometimes, but I think my ground wire may be too thick.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: A simple to install preamp that works. I have a classic Denon DP - 37F turntable and an amp/receiver with no preamp in either one. This solved my problem at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

product_meta.title: GOgroove Mini Phono Turntable Preamp Preamplifier with 12 Volt AC Adapter, RCA Input for Vinyl Record Player - Compatible with Audio Technica, Crosley, Jensen, Pioneer, 1byone and More Turntables
feature_bullets: COMPACT DESIGN fits on your bookshelf, desk, table so you can connect your turntable to your stereo receiver, speakers, or other audio device in any spot| Powered with 12 Volt AC Adapter (included)
CONVERTS TURNTABLES PHONO SOUND QUALITY to line level for better sounding audio and volume | 1/4 HEADPHONE PORT lets you plug in and listen directly to music (no volume control)
NECESSARY FOR CONNECTING TURNTABLE to newer speakers and receivers that do not have a phono input
EASY TO SET UP OUT OF THE BOX for a simple hook up the preamp to both turntable and audio device so you can enjoy vinyl in no time | ULTRA-LOW NOISE OPERATION for better sound and less distortion
RIAA EQUALIZATION boosts the volume signal for balanced, clear audio | BACKED BY 3 YEAR MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY
